Change has been successfully merged by Chris Burroughs
Wouldn't this be `if (toDelete.length)`. If I'm not on a mistake, slice will always create an array, even if it's empty.
I'm not strongly opposed to the change on the backups name format. May I know the reason, though?

With some testing, this sort doesn't work the way we want when there are old and new-named backup files. After a couple 'sdcadm ex update-gz-tools ...` runs:

```
[root@headnode (coal) /usbkey/extra/joysetup]# ls -alt
total 7772
-rwxr-xr-x   1 root     root        5883 Feb  7 22:40 agentsetup.sh
-rwxr-xr-x   1 root     root       20894 Feb  7 22:40 joysetup.sh
-rw-r--r--   1 root     root      638851 Feb  7 22:40 cn_tools.tar.gz
drwxr-xr-x   2 root     root          11 Feb  7 22:40 .
-rw-r--r--   1 root     root      631289 Feb  7 22:39 cn_tools.20180207T224006.tar.gz
-rw-r--r--   1 root     root      630397 Feb  7 22:36 cn_tools.2018-02-07T22:37:04.393Z.tar.gz
-rw-r--r--   1 root     root      632127 Feb  7 22:36 cn_tools.2018-02-07T22:36:44.527Z.tar.gz
-rw-r--r--   1 root     root      639234 Feb  7 22:35 cn_tools.2018-02-07T22:36:27.504Z.tar.gz
drwxr-xr-x   4 root     root           4 Feb  2 19:09 ..
-rw-r--r--   1 root     root         761 Feb  2 19:08 node.config
-rwxr-xr-x   1 root     root      637721 Feb  2 19:08 cn_tools.2018-02-07T22:35:52.442Z.tar.gz
[root@headnode (coal) /usbkey/extra/joysetup]# ls -alt
total 7772
-rwxr-xr-x   1 root     root        5883 Feb  7 22:40 agentsetup.sh
-rwxr-xr-x   1 root     root       20894 Feb  7 22:40 joysetup.sh
-rw-r--r--   1 root     root      629484 Feb  7 22:40 cn_tools.tar.gz
drwxr-xr-x   2 root     root          11 Feb  7 22:40 .
-rw-r--r--   1 root     root      638851 Feb  7 22:40 cn_tools.20180207T224059.tar.gz
-rw-r--r--   1 root     root      630397 Feb  7 22:36 cn_tools.2018-02-07T22:37:04.393Z.tar.gz
-rw-r--r--   1 root     root      632127 Feb  7 22:36 cn_tools.2018-02-07T22:36:44.527Z.tar.gz
-rw-r--r--   1 root     root      639234 Feb  7 22:35 cn_tools.2018-02-07T22:36:27.504Z.tar.gz
drwxr-xr-x   4 root     root           4 Feb  2 19:09 ..
-rw-r--r--   1 root     root         761 Feb  2 19:08 node.config
-rwxr-xr-x   1 root     root      637721 Feb  2 19:08 cn_tools.2018-02-07T22:35:52.442Z.tar.gz
```

we are only getting the *last* newly named backup file saved, and 4 of the old named backup files.


Ah, actually I think the issue is that you want to *reverse* the sorted names:

```
# wrong
> tarballs.sort()
[ 'cn_tools.2018-02-07T22:35:52.442Z.tar.gz',
  'cn_tools.2018-02-07T22:36:27.504Z.tar.gz',
  'cn_tools.2018-02-07T22:36:44.527Z.tar.gz',
  'cn_tools.2018-02-07T22:37:04.393Z.tar.gz',
  'cn_tools.20180207T224059.tar.gz' ]
> tarballs.slice(4)
[ 'cn_tools.20180207T224059.tar.gz' ]

# correct
> tarballs.sort().reverse()
[ 'cn_tools.20180207T224059.tar.gz',
  'cn_tools.2018-02-07T22:37:04.393Z.tar.gz',
  'cn_tools.2018-02-07T22:36:44.527Z.tar.gz',
  'cn_tools.2018-02-07T22:36:27.504Z.tar.gz',
  'cn_tools.2018-02-07T22:35:52.442Z.tar.gz' ]
> tarballs.slice(4)
[ 'cn_tools.2018-02-07T22:35:52.442Z.tar.gz' ]
```

Yikes, thanks on the reverse.

See other conversation about testability.
